CWEs: CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
description: The function is vulnerable to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks. The data parameter is directly used as input for the .text() method of a jQuery object without any sanitization or encoding. An attacker could inject malicious scripts as data, which would then be executed in the context of the user's browser when the page is rendered.
